thread.title: Bears release defensive lineman Jeremiah Ratliff
thread.title_full: Bears release defensive lineman Jeremiah Ratliff

title: Bears release defensive lineman Jeremiah Ratliff
text: Add a message (optional) Success - Article sent! close John Starks/jstarks@dailyherald.com ¬ Chicago Bears defensive tackle Jeremiah Ratliff celebrates his second sack of Miami Dolphins quarterback Ryan Tannehill Sunday at Soldier Field in Chicago. Daily Herald Report In another housecleaning move, the Chicago Bears released veteran defensive lineman Jeremiah Ratliff on Thursday. In a statement released to the media, Bears general manager Ryan Pace said the former Pro Bowler was not a good fit for the team any longer: "We felt moving forward without Jeremiah was in the best interest of our team." In a related move, the Bears added defensive lineman Ziggy Hood to the roster." • Check back later at dailyherald.com for reaction and analysis from Bob LeGere.
